<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

## Description {#details}

A <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue">DomainValue</a> is a bit like <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveintervals">LiveIntervals</a>&#39; ValNo, but it also keeps track of execution domains.

An open <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue">DomainValue</a> represents a set of instructions that can still switch execution domain. Multiple registers may refer to the same open <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue">DomainValue</a> - they will eventually be collapsed to the same execution domain.

A collapsed <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue">DomainValue</a> represents a single register that has been forced into one of more execution domains. There is a separate collapsed <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue">DomainValue</a> for each register, but it may contain multiple execution domains. A register value is initially created in a single execution domain, but if we were forced to pay the penalty of a domain crossing, we keep track of the fact that the register is now available in multiple domains.

Definition at line 51 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/executiondomainfix-h">ExecutionDomainFix.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Member Attributes

### AvailableDomains {#ac900f658d1c226c23057b843aa5df4d0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="unsigned llvm::DomainValue::AvailableDomains">
Bitmask of available domains.

For an open <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue">DomainValue</a>, it is the still possible domains for collapsing. For a collapsed <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue">DomainValue</a> it is the domains where the register is available for free.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/executiondomainfix-h/#l00058">58</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/executiondomainfix-h">ExecutionDomainFix.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Twiddleable instructions using or defining these registers.

### Next {#a81594f3b613bebc91349100513f9f0f9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>DomainValue&#42; llvm::DomainValue::Next</>}>
Pointer to the next <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue">DomainValue</a> in a chain.

When two DomainValues are merged, Victim.Next is set to point to Victor, so old <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue">DomainValue</a> references can be updated by following the chain.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/executiondomainfix-h/#l00063">63</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/executiondomainfix-h">ExecutionDomainFix.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
